result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph R Porter

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[ma] Case called at 1:18 PM 
Defendant Joseph R Porter in court.  Attorney Melanie Flint in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Victim present in courtroom gallery

The Court reviews court record.

The Court adjourns to allow a public defender to be appointed.

Mr. Porter asserts homelessness, financial hardship, difficulty getting to court. 

Statement made by Victim, requesting no contact be lifted.

Atty Flint indicates State opposes any bond modification.

The Court modifies bond to 'no violent contact with Victim 1' and removes no presence condition. 

recess: 1:31pm
NEXT: Status on 11/14/22 at 2:30pm

The above-named applicant is eligible for State Public Defender
representation. The eligibility determination was made on 8/22/2022. No attorney is
available to attend the hearing scheduled for 8/25/22 .
Status conference on August 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

[ae] case called 1:23 PM Defendant Joseph R Porter in court. Atty Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin
Defendant provides status on obtaining an attorney.
The Court orders the Defendant to go to SPD today to apply for their services and if he does not qualify then he is to report to the Clerk of Courts Office to fill out a Petition for Court Appointed Attorney today

The Defendant requests a bond modification to remove no contact order. Alleged Victim in court makes statement. The State objects to any bond modification at this time. 
The Court advises the Defendant to have his attorney [once obtained] to file a formal motion .

NEXT: Status of Counsel on 8/25/22 at 1:15 pm
recess: 1:29 pm
Adjourned initial appearance on August 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Order to Seal Victim Key
The original document was titled: Victim Witness Key
The original history event date is: 07-25-2022

[ma] Case called at 1:36 PM 
Defendant Joseph R Porter appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond-purposes only; Mr. Porter declined to be evaluated for SPD services). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies date of birth
Address updated to: 3303 Aurora Lane, Janesville 53548
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court preserves preliminary hearing time limits

The Court requires a $2500  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Victim 1
--no presence at the residence of Victim 1

recess 1:45  pm. 

NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 8/11/22 at 1:15pm (status of counsel)

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph R Porter
Current: 3303 Aurora Lane, Janesville, WI 53548 United States  (Effective: 07-25-2022)
Prior: 479 N. Washington St, Janesville, WI
